required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cardiovascular Effects of Muscle Relaxation During Laparoscopic Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Neuromuscular Relaxation and Nociception Guided Anaesthesia on Hemodynamic Variables During Lower Abdominal Laparoscopic Surgery: a Strategy Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: Many surgical procedures are performed using the laparoscopic approach. However, insufflation of the abdomen (pneumoperitoneum) has detrimental hemodynamic effects. The investigators intend to investigate the effect of deep neuromuscular block and nociception guided anaesthesia on hemodynamic variables during pneumoperitoneum for lower abdominal laparoscopic surgery.

secondary_outcome.description: Cardiac output (l/min) as measured by non invasive arterial pulse contour anlysis
Cardiac output (l/min) as measured by non invasive arterial pulse contour anlysis
Cardiac output (l/min) as measured by non invasive arterial pulse contour anlysis

other_outcome.description: Left ventricular ejection fraction measured by TEE
Left ventricular ejection fraction measured by TEE
Left ventricular ejection fraction measured by TEE

arm_group.description: Deep neuromuscular blockade (post tetanic count 1-2 twitches) and nociception guided anaesthesia

intervention.description: Deep neuromuscular blockade (PTC 1-2) Nociception level index (NOL) target 10-25
